definitions: Recurring or habitual deviations from ideal body alignment.
Predictable and often compensatory changes in posture that can lead to musculoskeletal imbalances and pain.
Specific and identifiable ways in which the body deviates from its optimal structural position.
examples: Identifying postural distortion patterns is crucial for effective physical therapy.
Many chronic pains are linked to underlying postural distortion patterns.
Exercise programs can help correct certain postural distortion patterns.
